Name: Finger tip of sitting statue of Ramesses II
Description: Flat finger tip of a colossal statue. The smooth surface of the fracture is situated slightly above the first joint. The underside is cut off evenly. The extensions at the sides to the adjoining fingers reach to the beginning of the nail, slightly higher on the left side; the tips are bevelled off in a downward direction. The straight nail, which is rounded at the nail bed, is indented where it touches the finger on three sides. The carved top of the nail runs in a convex curve parallel to the finger tip.
